dcterms:creator: Madhurananda Pahar
Igor Miranda
Andreas Diacon
Thomas Niesler
dcterms:description: This corpus consists of spontaneous coughing audio collected at a small tuberculosis (TB) clinic near Cape Town, South Africa. The dataset contains 6000 cough audio by patients undergoing TB treatment and 11393 non-cough audio such as laughter, doors opening and objects moving. This data was intended for the development of cough detection algorithms and the recordings were made in a multi-ward environment using a smartphone with an external microphone.
dcterms:title: TASK dataset

dcterms:creator: GHR Botha
G Theron
RM Warren
M Klopper
K Dheda
PD Van Helden
TR Niesler
dcterms:description: This dataset contains 746 voluntary coughs by 38 subjects compiled for the development of cough audio classification systems. Audio recording took place in a controlled indoor booth, using a Rode M3 microphone and an audio field recorder.
dcterms:title: Brooklyn dataset

dcterms:creator: Madhurananda Pahar
Marisa Klopper
Byron Reeve
Robin Warren
Grant Theron
Thomas Niesler
dcterms:description: This dataset consists of 1358 voluntary coughs by 51 patients, compiled for the development of cough audio classification. Audio recording took place in an outdoor booth located at a busy primary healthcare clinic. The recording was performed using a Rode M1 microphone and an audio field recorder.
dcterms:title: Wallacedene dataset

dcterms:creator: Jort F Gemmeke
Daniel PW Ellis
Dylan Freedman
Aren Jansen
Wade Lawrence
R Channing Moore
Manoj Plakal
Marvin Ritter
dcterms:description: The Google Audio Set dataset contains excerpts from 1.8 million Youtube videos that have been manually labelled according to an ontology of 632 audio event categories. The Freesound audio database is a collection of tagged sounds uploaded by contributors from around the world. From these two datasets, a collection of coughing audio, sneezing audio, speech excerpts, and other non-vocal audio was compiled.
dcterms:title: Google Audio Set & Freesound

dcterms:creator: Vassil Panayotov
Guoguo Chen
Daniel Povey
Sanjeev Khudanpur
dcterms:description: As a source of speech audio data, this dataset includes utterances by 28 male and 28 female speakers from the freely available LibriSpeech corpus. These recordings contain very little noise and the large size of the corpus allowed easy gender balancing.
dcterms:title: LibriSpeech

dcterms:creator: Neeraj Sharma
Prashant Krishnan
Rohit Kumar
Shreyas Ramoji
Srikanth Raj Chetupalli
Nirmala R.
Prasanta Kumar Ghosh
Sriram Ganapathy
dcterms:description: This dataset is specifically developed with the testing of classification algorithms for COVID-19 detection in mind. Data collection is web-based, and participants contribute by using their smartphones to record their coughing, breathing and speech.
dcterms:title: Coswara dataset

dcterms:creator: Björn W. Schuller
Anton Batliner
Christian Bergler
Cecilia Mascolo
Jing Han
Iulia Lefter
Heysem Kaya
Shahin Amiri-parian
Alice Baird
Lukas Stappen
Sandra Ottl
Maurice Gerczuk
Panaguiotis Tzirakis
Chloë Brown
Jagmohan Chauhan
Andreas Grammenos
Apinan Hasthanasombat
Dimitris Spathis
Tong Xia
Pietro Cicuta
M. ˜Rothkrantz
Leon J. Joeri Zwerts
Jelle Treep
Casper Kaandorp
dcterms:description: This dataset was provided as a part of the 2021 Interspeech Computational Paralinguistics ChallengE (ComParE). It contains recordings of both coughs and speech, where the latter is the utterance ‘I hope my data can help to manage the virus pandemic’ in the speaker’s language of choice.
dcterms:title: ComParE dataset

dcterms:creator: Madhurananda Pahar
Marisa Klopper
Robin Warren
Thomas Niesler
dcterms:description: This dataset was collected in South Africa as part of this research and currently contains recordings of coughing by 18 COVID-19 positive and 26 COVID-19 negative subjects. Audio was pre-processed in the same way as the Coswara data.
dcterms:title: Sarcos dataset
